paper_abstract: As the ubiquitous access to vast and remote information sources from portable devices becomes commonplace, the need from users to perform searches in keyboard-unfriendly situations grows substantially, thus triggering the increased demand of voice search sessions. This paper proposes a methodology that addresses different dimensions of scalability of mixed-initiative voice search in automatic spoken dialog systems. The strategy is based on splitting the complexity of the fully-constrained grammar (one that tightly covers the entire hypothesis space) into a fixed/low complexity phonotactic grammar followed by an index mechanism that dynamically assembles a second-pass grammar that consists of only a handful of hypotheses. The experimental analysis demonstrates different dimensions of scalability achieved by the proposed method using actual WHITEPAGEs-residential data. (C) 2011 Elsevier B.V. All rights reserved.
paper_title: Index-based incremental language model for scalable directory assistance
